Administration.text:
Type:
Antifungal
(
Candida
, mycoses,
Aspergillosis
)
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: IV, PO
Common Trade Names: Vfend

Pediatric_Dosing.text: Children >12 yo: same as adult dosing

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: D
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: PO preferred, no adjustement to dose
Hepatic dosing: mild-moderate impairment- reduce dose. Severe: avoid using

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Concomitant use of carbamazepine or CYP3A4 substrates, ritonavir, ergots, barbiturates, rifampin, sirolimus, or St. John's Wort

Serious.text:
Prolonged QT, dysrhythmias, cardiac arrest
Erythema multiforme, SJS, TEN
Malignant melanoma, squamous cell carcinoma
Hepatotoxicity
Renal failure
Toxic encephalopathy
Pancreatitis
Optic neuritis

Common.text:
Peripheral edema
Rash
Nausea/vomiting, diarrhea
Headache
Visual disturbances
Hallucinations
Fever

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: Dose dependant, non-linear pharmacokinetics
Metabolism: CYP2C19, CYP2C9 and CYP3A4
Excretion: Renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Triazole antifungal: inhibits synthesis of fungal cell wall ergosterol
